intro: Tetrastigma maluense, commonly known as the climbing vine of the grape family, is a woody, climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and tendrils that help it climb. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by berries that are typically red or yellow when ripe. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
